According to Axios, Harris will skip her planned anti-Trump one-liners to make things less personal. There also will be increased safety measures. The candidates will be 12 feet apart, instead of seven. Dana, you and Juan are both going. What are you watching for?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, apparently, there's going to be Plexiglas between them as well. So you got 12 feet and Plexiglas. I think everyone's going to be OK. And I'll be with Juan and our colleagues. So, I'm really looking forward to this. Usually, vice presidential debate wouldn't really affect a race at all. And I don't think it will, in this case, either. I do you think it's very interesting that Kamala Harris had this amazing rollout as the vice presidential choice, and you really have not seen anything from her since. She does very few interviews. Now, she's out and about on the campaign trail a little bit, but we really haven't heard from her and she has not been pressed on policy at all. And if there's one thing Mike Pence can do, he can press on policy. So, I'm looking forward to it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: And is it her policy or Joe Biden's policy because Juan, her policy is a great deal when she was running for the nomination, a great deal more left than Joe Biden, and well, including abolishing private health insurance.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think this has to be about Joe Biden's policies. I mean, this is -- he's the head of the ticket. He's what people anticipate that they're voting for. As Dana said, in normal circumstances, the vice presidential debate is pretty forgettable. But you've got one candidate who's had Coronavirus, or has Coronavirus, and you got another candidate who's elderly, both in their 70s, I should say. So, everybody's going to be looking at this with more attention because the potential for either of these people to actually take over is very real. I will say in terms of the safety precautions this weekend, we had Jamie Harrison, the Senate candidate down in South Carolina running against Lindsey Graham, and they had the petition there. It was the first time I'd seen it in place. And it seemed to work pretty effectively. I think the second thing to say about safety is I'm not sure they're going to have anybody in that auditorium. I think there's a push to say why do you have people in. Last time in Cleveland, there's great upset to this day about the fact that the Trump family wasn't wearing masks. Why take the risk?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Jesse, the Trump campaign is saying that the President will participate in the next presidential debate.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, was that October 14th or something?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: 15th.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: 15th? Yes, that'll be a good one. I think more people might even tune in that one to see how he does after recovering from Coronavirus. Yes, I agree with Juan. This is a big debate just because of the age of the -- of the people on the top of the ticket. And Kamala Harris hasn't answered about fracking, she hasn't answered about court-packing. She definitely has to answer for some of the radical things she ran on. And she's not talented enough politically to defend her record and Biden's record. Remember, she dropped out before I think 2020. She was unliked by the Democratic primary voters and she wasn't a great debater. But I do think the media will crown her winner just because she'll have some sort of sassy hip liner to that they'll say was a real clap backer zinger, and that's all you need in the media today.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: That's true. Greg, you look pensive. What's on your mind?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, no, because Juan and Jesse said -- agreed on the same kind of thing which has always makes me think, OK, this is important. You both brought up the age. You said this is an important debate because of the age of the other candidates. And you have two candidates working into their eighth decade which are dealing with two different risks or comorbidities. So, you're almost saying like the spare tire is more important than the tire on the car because it's in better condition. That's kind of -- what -- so what does that tell you? It tells you that is it time to have age limits on the primary candidates that we're actually -- the reason why this is important is because the main attraction is so old, that the opening band is more important than the main attraction. That's kind of interesting. Having said that though, this to me is like a cold -- this debate is like a cold glass of milk after eating a plate of spicy hot wings from last week. You know? So, don't know. It might be a little soothing, but it also might be a little boring. How long is it? Is it like an hour?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's 90 minutes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: 90 minutes? I don't know. It'll be over in 30.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'll send you some Jasper pictures.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, please do. I'll probably be watching you with Jasper.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: Indeed. "ONE MORE THING" up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "ONE MORE THING." Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have some very exciting personal news to announce. It involves the Watters family.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have COVID?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I do not have COVID. I've been tested. Emma is pregnant.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thank you, guys, very much. I'm very happy. The twins were very excited. We told them over the weekend. And I know how much you guys love gender reveals especially you, Greg. So, we've gotten cupcakes --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We're not going to blow anything up?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. We've gotten cupcakes for everybody on set, and if you bite into the cupcake, it will tell you the gender.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, one, two, three? Try to do it at the same time.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: One, two, three, go. Oh, I see. Oh, I see.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh, it's a girl.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan, it's a boy. It's a boy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's a boy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Blue means boy, Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Fake news.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Fake news on the gender reveal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse, congratulations, and to the twins.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: High five.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When does the Little Greg Jr. due?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We haven't decided on the name yet. We know it won't be Greg though.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It might Gutfeld, however.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, it will not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Congratulations. Emma, we are so happy for you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cheers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I love you, Emma.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Congratulations. All right, Dagen.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.utterance: With the vice presidential debate this week, enter for a free chance to win $25,000 from our friends at Fox Bet. You can download the Fox Bet app, pick six possible outcomes. Watch the Vice President debate on Fox News, of course, on October 7th. See how it all unfolds. Download the Fox Bet app now. Well, after the show during Bret.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's the only "ONE MORE THING" you have?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How dare you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow. I mean, because you could have had more time but we because we have a lot of time. It means we'll give Greg more time. Hi, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How are you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Good. How are you doing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm all right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I feel pretty bad because I'm on Atkins diet and I had that cupcake. But I felt I should because Jesse gave -- you know, I can't turn down that. So, now I'm going to be -- feel like completely angry all night because I had this. All right -- I am. It's going to bother me that I had - - I had --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Be a man, Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- I had sugar. Look, when you get to my age, you're going to be doing this. Greg's travel news. As most of you know, I purchased a car. And I'm so excited to be driving it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's your new baby.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. This is a good shot of me. I've got the car. I'm driving it around.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, so cute.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's got great mileage. It's -- I consider it a classic car.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You could park it anywhere.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I can park it anywhere. And you know, it's just a one-seater though so -- which is good for me because I'm often alone.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. You can be socially distanced in your car.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I try my best to be socially distance when I'm driving. Actually, I did get a new car. I did get -- but I'm waiting for it. It hasn't come yet. And it's not a new car, it's 23 years old.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. So, are we going to reveal it or we're not?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't want to take -- I don't want to steal any Jesse's thunder. But it's a -- it's a --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But it's a --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a Defender. It's a used Defender.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's so used. It's really used too. You should see this thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan, what do you have?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, first, I really think that's great. I think the girls are going to love having a boy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They're very excited.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They're going to be like, you know, big sister, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know. Very, very new.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Anyway, everyone knows that with the virus around, we're all looking for contact-free delivery. Now, that includes pizza delivery, but sometimes you know, things don't go as planned. Take a look at this video, folks, of a pizza delivery that ended up in the wrong paws. Yes, that's a bear in Colorado Springs eating a pizza that was left on a porch. The beer ate it in less than two minutes. Holly Vergunst who ordered the pizza, ordered -- open the box, and in a few minutes, realized, hey, this is empty. What's going on? She didn't know what happened so she checked the video tape. That's when she saw that bear. Wildlife experts in the area say bears are fattening up for the fall and winter and can smell food from four miles away.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's not just Hungry Hungry Hippos you have to watch out for, you also have to keep an eye out for famish bears these days.
